Alerts

Alerts help draw attention to brief confirmation or warning messages—or any other important information—that shouldn't be overlooked while your visitor scans the page.

Alert Accessibility Tip

When modifying alert colors, be sure to check that your colors meet a sufficient contrast ratio.

Don't rely on color alone to convey an alert's meaning. Always include a visual icon for those who experience colors differently.

Alert Types

Out-of-the-box, the NYC Core framework offers three accessible colors relating to each type of alert: Green implies confirm, Blue implies attention, while Red implies warn.

Across the Framework Font Awesome, an open-source icon library, is used for all icons. If you're unsure how to use Font Awesome, read their docs.
